courses.subject: GEJC
courses.title: The Hong Kong Story
courses.description: From a colony of the British Empire to the SAR of the PRC, the Hong Kong story has undergone many ups and downs, twists and turns. Designed from a sociological perspective, but specifically for students without sociological background or much background knowledge about Hong Kong, this course shall guide them through the journey of Hong Kong and its people so far. It will pick up popular images about Hong Kong, such as "a laissez-faire economic miracle", "the safest place in the world", or "the land of opportunity", evaluating their validities or tracing their origins and implications. Selected contemporary issues arising from the city’s sustainable development will also be discussed, such as migration, inequality, and affordable housing. Integrating experiential learning and e-learning strategies, this course should offer students a range of new learning experiences and new angles of approaching the Hong Kong society.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For Shaw College students and Year 1 students of Wu Yee Sun College only.
Not for students who have taken UGEC2865, SOCI1201 or SOCI2104.
courses.course_attributes:
SDG-GE #1 No Poverty
SDG-GE #8 Decent Work and Economic Growth
SDG-GE #10 Reducing Inequality
SDG-GE #11 Sustainable Cities and Communities
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, students should be able to:

1. Go beyond the constraint of individual experiences and recognize the broader influence of Hong Kong’s post-war social developments on Hong Kong people's personal biography and community living.
2. Identify and critically discuss dominant imageries of social life in Hong Kong.
3. Analyze everyday encounters in the community of Hong Kong and evaluate their broader significance with consolidated knowledge and perspectives gained from this course.
4. Evaluate and reflect on selected issues concerning the sustainable development of Hong Kong
5. Engage in self-initiated learning processes with technological aid geared towards active discovery.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. ​Introduction – The Hong Kong spectacle

2. Hong Kong as a crown jewel of the British Empire: Colonial history and legacy

3. Hong Kong as an international hub: The rise of Hong Kong in the world-system

4. Hong Kong as an economic miracle? The myth of laissez-faire and industrialization

5. Hong Kong as a migration center: Cultural diversity and social polarization in Hong Kong
– SDG#1, 8, 10 – this lecture will discuss migration in HK with reference to SDG indicators that are ‘migration-related’ and ‘disaggregation’ related . Specifically, the lecture will discuss protection of migrant labour rights and promote safe and secure migrant working environment (8.8); facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration (10.7), reducing poverty and better social protection of all population members, such as ethnic minorities in HK (1.3.1).

6. Hong Kong as a place of conflict over hearts and minds: identity politics beyond left and right

7. Hong Kong as a divided society: From land of opportunity to land of inequality?
– SDG#10 – this lecture will introduce the concept of inequality and examine the evolving social mobility system of HK and the inequalities in outcome (10.3), hence giving students insights on methods to reduce HK’s inequality (e.g. wage and social protection policies 10.4).

8. Hong Kong as an urban jungle: Affordable housing in Hong Kong
– SDG#11 – this lecture will examine HK’s current housing problem within the SDG framework of adequate, safe and affordable housing (11.1). Comparison will be made with overseas cases to discuss how to enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization in the case of HK (11.3).

9. Hong Kong as the safest place in the world? From gang-land to cop-land to Disneyland

10. Hong Kong as a city of protest: Social movements past and now

11. Hollywood of the East: Cultural industry in Hong Kong

12. Conclusion: Cosmopolitan Hong Kong

courses.subject: GEJC
courses.title: College, University and Community: Student-Oriented Teaching
courses.description:
This is a student-oriented small group tutorial course connected to GEJC1120 for Chung Chi students only. This course is designed specifically for year one students, with the aims to enhance students to adapt to the learning environment and life style in The Chinese University, allow them to get a better understanding to university life, university education and the lectures of GEJC1120 through small group discussion.

The enrollment of this course is in connection with the 2 unit course GEJC1120 “College, University and Community”.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For Year 1 Chung Chi College students only. Students must take GEJC1120 in the same term for taking this course. Not for students who have taken GECC1130, GECC1131 or GECC1132
courses.course_syllabus:
The purpose of the STOT classes is to engage students in the discussions on topics related to university education, college life or topics in GEJC1120. Students and class teacher can decide on their topic of interest for discussion. Recommended topics include:

1. University Life: Problems and Solutions
2. Emotion Management, Time Management, Money Management
3. Issues in the Education System of HK and Worldwide
4. The Role of University in a Changing World
5. The Search for Values of the Youth of Hong Kong
6. The Role of University Students: The Ambition and Responsibilities of Intellectuals
7. Liberal Education / General Education and Humanity
8. The History and Heritage of Chung Chi College
9. CUHK and Chung Chi College: Traditions and Ideals
10. Value, Ethics, Integrity, Moral Judgement
11. The Idea of Love, Intimacy, Affection
12. Friendship, Family Relationship, Kinship, Teacher-student relationship, Apprenticeship
13. Self-fulfillment and Vision of Life; Contribution to the Society and Mankind
14. A topic covered in GEJC1120

STOT 討論內容圍繞大學教育、大學生活或GEJC1120之講課課題，可由導師及組員決定，建議題目如下：

1. 大學生活︰困難與解決方法
2. 情緒管理、時間管理、理財
3. 香港與世界之學制問題
4. 大學的角色之演變
5. 大學生的品格
6. 大學生之自我定位：知識分子的抱負與責任
7. 通識教育與人文精神
8. 崇基歷史與承傳
9. 誠信與道德判斷
10. 崇基與中大的歷史淵源及理想實踐
11. 情愛的意義
12. 友情、親情與師生情之情感生活
13. 成己與立命、經世與立群
14. GEJC1120其中一節講課之題目
